meanings.definition: Playfully lively and full of energy.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was so frisky, jumping around happily.
meanings.sent2: The kittens were feeling frisky and chasing each other around the room.
meanings.sent3: The frisky squirrel kept darting around the tree, trying to catch its own tail.
meanings.sent4: The frisky colt galloped across the field, its mane flowing in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The frisky children giggled and ran in circles, enjoying their game.

meanings.definition: Inclined to play or be lively.
meanings.sent1: The frisky puppy wagged its tail eagerly, ready to play fetch.
meanings.sent2: The frisky foal pranced around the paddock, full of youthful energy.
meanings.sent3: The frisky kitten pounced on a toy mouse, pretending to be a fierce hunter.
meanings.sent4: The frisky breeze rustled the leaves, making the trees dance in delight.
meanings.sent5: The frisky child skipped along the path, humming a cheerful tune.

meanings.definition: Energetic and lively in a playful way.
meanings.sent1: The frisky squirrel leaped from branch to branch, showing off its agility.
meanings.sent2: The frisky dolphin swam gracefully, performing flips and spins in the water.
meanings.sent3: The frisky wind blew the colorful kite high up into the sky.
meanings.sent4: The frisky melody of the song made everyone tap their feet and clap along.
meanings.sent5: The frisky rabbit hopped around the garden, enjoying the sunshine and fresh air.
